result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus D. Kasper

defendant.name: Kasper, Marcus D.
defendant.address: W8172 Hwy B, Lake Mills, WI 53551

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of plea & sentencing hearing held on 10-24-2014

Cases 14CF238, 14CF254, 14CF278 & 14CF348 called together at 10:35 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Marcus D. Kasper in court, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF348: Service of the Complaint Admitted; Reading Waived; Charge/Penalties recited

14CF278: Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Kasper waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information
; Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered  on Ct #4-14CF238 & plea of "Guilty" on Count #1-14CF278; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1-14CF254 & Count #2-14CF238 & Count #2-14CF278
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses out-right Case 14CF348
ADA Hall submits victim impact statement

On Ct #1-14CF278, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, concurrent, with conditions:
On Ct #4-14CF238, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, concurrent, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment (within 120 days of dispo) & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain or make legitimate, honest attempt to obtain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol & non-prescribed controlled substances or illegal drugs
--No acts/threats of violence againsts any persons
--No contact with Scott Heiman or presence at his residence
--No contact with Brandon Severson or presence at any residence where he resides
--To pay costs of $243 (14CF238)
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge (14CF238)
--To pay costs of $$268 (14CF278)
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge (14CF278)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand (14CF278)
--To pay restitution as determined by restitution hearing if any payable to Scott Heiman
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee if probation is ordered following restitution hearing

Days credit for time already served: 76 days - 14CF278 (8/9/14 - today's date)
Days credit for time already served: 1 day - 14CF238
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 11:27 am 

NEXT: (1) 14CF238 - Schedule Restitution Hearing 12/5/14 at 9:30 am - Send notices
